website_summaries.verdict: Whether you are a do-it-yourselfer or a professional construction worker, this well-made bag offers a sturdy design, ample space for the most needed tools, and a budget-friendly price.
pros: Crafted by a top name in tools, this bag offers convenient features including multiple pockets, stable padded bottom, and a limited lifetime warranty
cons: It's not huge, but this is a perk for some users
The zipper could be better – has been reported to malfunction/break

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the dimensions.
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to pay attention to the dimensions not the picture. As many times as I have bought purses and bags and luggage bags on line I should have known that. In the picture it looks like a large bag but it’s quite small. I wanted a bag for my jigsaw and blades and this is too small for that. You could carry a hammer and a few tools like screwdrivers in it but nothing very big.
customer_reviews.author: Marian

customer_reviews.title: Three months and the zipper broke.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at the end of December and the zipper already broke. Otherwise a good buy but it doesn’t hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D

customer_reviews.title: Two Bags, Two Defective Zippers
customer_reviews.text: Received the first one I ordered - defective zipper. Amazon quickly sent a replacement and, wouldn't you know it, it also had the exact same zipper defect. Two strikes and I'm done with Stanley, they are clearly having some quality control issues with these bags.
customer_reviews.author: FTW

customer_reviews.title: 3 years old and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these from amazon and a third form a local retailer after I realized how much I like them. I made a bag for auto, home, and electrical. I am able to keep the tools I need for different types of jobs together and organized. They are not too large or too small. Holds the tools i need without being a catch all for a lot of junk I don't need. Well constructed. I have used and abused them for almost three years now and they are holding up well. I expect to get several more years of use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Roth

customer_reviews.title: WAY small
customer_reviews.text: From the photos I thought I was getting a decent size tool bag. Nope. It's more like a lunch bag size bag. Really small. I wanted it to organize tools and stuff in my car trunk. I guess I can use it to hold small horse clippers or something. It's even too small for plumbing parts. Wasted my money. Not the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Trainer Lady

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately... I did not have good luck
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received had a faulty zipper... when closed, the top "folds down", and the zipper must travel up, and around a bend...the zipper separated... rending the zipper useless.. the company very promptly sent a replacement at no charge... which did the exact same thing. This time, the zipper won't even open....don't know if it's a design flaw, or just cheap materials, but I'm very disappointed. This was exactly what I was looking for to keep a few tools I use in my studio... but I'll keep looking. Not even worth $10....
customer_reviews.author: Thenardier

customer_reviews.title: Small bag but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This Stanley tool bag is nicely made out of canvas type material with heavy duty stitching. It has lots of pockets both inside and outside. The zippered opening is large so you have no problem fitting bigger tools into the bag. What I didn't realize is that the 12 inches in the description meant it was 12 inches in length not in height. So, my drill barely fits laying at an angle. But it will go in the bag along with the charger, drill bits, and screw attachments. Overall, it is a nice small bag...and it matches all my Stanley tools!
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke on first zip.
customer_reviews.text: VERY disappointed in this Stanley.product. Zipper broke on the.first zip. Not an expensive bag, but still...
customer_reviews.author: sue cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool bag for the price. The 'doctor bag' opening is nice to see in there easier, but it means that you have the have the zippers all the way unzipped in order to open it. Also, I wish the inside was a lighter color to make it easier to see everything in there. I only have a few tools in there right now, and it works great for me, but this isn't a huge tool bag that's going to hold everything. It does satisfy what I was looking for though.
customer_reviews.author: BagLady

customer_reviews.title: It works 2 years later.
customer_reviews.text: I've had for 2 years.. at first I thought it would be too small ..its not.. very durable .. I've kept it by my side on 14 hour jobs in the freezing rain , and as dainty as it looks it still holds up.. other simaler products I've had and come to expect zipper failure, not with this one. Zipper as tough as a ox on steroids. I would buy again .BUT. due to great craftsmanship..after 2 years I dont need too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good size bag for small tools, works pretty well for my needs minus the somewhat temperamental zipper.
customer_reviews.text: Good bag that fits quite a bit of my smaller tools. Only downside to this bag is the zipper is somewhat temperamental and can be tricky to open with two hands, is next to impossible with just one hand if the other is tied up holding something. That said, I like the quality of the material used in the bag itself and would recommend this to anyone looking for a decent price on a small toolbag.
customer_reviews.author: EricTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Great materials, poor design
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers, the zipper on mine wouldn't open. Eventually I applied too much force and the tag flew off. I ended up using a knife to cut the top of the bag to get my tools out and into something more durable. Granted, it took a couple years to happen, but I really think it should not have in the first place. Would have given five stars, but this glaring design flaw kills it for me.
customer_reviews.author: RickM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for regular household & car use
customer_reviews.text: Great bag - the smaller size is perfect to carry frequently used tools like screwdrivers, pliers, etc.. It's nicely made and has plenty of pockets inside and out to hold shorter items. The longer pocket on the inside back wall has two Velcro tabs to help keep it closed, and front center pocket has a Velcro closure. I'd prefer a couple of zippered pockets instead of the Velcro, but that's just me. Very happy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: StyleSmart

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design, not too satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Strong material that holds my tools well Cons: -The main zipper doesn’t work well, so don’t plan on ever zipping this bag up. I had to return the first bag because I tried to zip it up and the zipper broke. I can already tell I’ll break the second bag if I even try to zip it shut. I don’t think I’d buy this bag again if given the chance.
customer_reviews.author: kslu8

customer_reviews.title: My go-to bag 4-EVA
customer_reviews.text: I don't carry any tools, but need room for many small supplies as I walk around. This bag is durable, small, wire-lined and perfect. My first one lasted about four years but I still have it, and it never developed weak spots or breaks in any stitching. Velcro exterior pouch, non-velcro exterior pouches (lots of them) Interior velcro pouch, and non-velcro, too. For a small and simple bag, this covers all the bases if you don't need to carry any complicated tools or a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: aaron mccormick

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Knockoff
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first bag 2 years ago. It is a great bag, sturdy & well made. I bought a second bag a couple months ago, what a flimsy cheap piece of junk. It is sad to see quality products destroyed by greedy management. I deeply regret the recent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JDL

customer_reviews.title: Size of bag is 11" not 12"
customer_reviews.text: The item that I received is not the same as the one I purchased, (via image on website) the label with the Stanley name is different kind of has a representation of a knockoff also the item description says 12 inch but as shown in my picture of tag on bag it's an 11 inch.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Consulmagno

customer_reviews.title: Its a bag
customer_reviews.text: Nothing high-tech here, though it is well made. I got it for my daughter, who, living on her own for the first time, had recently complained about needing some tools. So I got her a few basic tools and something she could use to store them in, all in one place. Its long enough so that a hammer will fit into it. It works.
customer_reviews.author: OhNoBillS

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag not Wide Enough
customer_reviews.text: Well made and tough. Plenty of pockets. The big thing I don't like about it is the it is not nearly wide enough for its depth. That means finding something small in the bottom of the bag is pretty tough. Should be at least two inches wider. I won't buy another this size.
customer_reviews.author: L. Van

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase this Tool Bag
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new work tool bag. This one was great for going from job to job, small yet big enough to carry a handful of tools. After using it only 4 days, the zipper broke. And I’m past the return date. Disappointing because I’ve never had a problem with Stanley products. Goes to show what a decline in quality can do to a once great company. Avoid this bag & possibly other Stanley products.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Mallon

customer_reviews.title: Cute Bag! But found a similar size at Home Depot for $5
customer_reviews.text: I really love this little tool bag - it's the perfect size for small apartments, condos, or even dorm rooms. However, check your local Home Depot or Lowes. I went to my Home Depot around mid-December and found that they carried the same sized tool bag for just under $5. It was too late to return this bag, so not a huge fan that I paid nearly 3x the amount. Sad panda.
customer_reviews.author: NotThatMumboJumbo

customer_reviews.title: Small—Pay Close Attention To Measurements!
customer_reviews.text: The bag is attractive and sturdy. Lots of pockets and compartments BUT it’s small. I should have paid closer attention to measurements. It will accommodate a small amount of items. Should be fine for my needs—I hope!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: It works great! I keep my Dremel 300 series and engraver ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to hold all of my Dremel Tool accessories and tool. It works great! I keep my Dremel 300 series and engraver In the side pockets. Inside I keep my new 50pc Diamond Burr set, Tekton 6655 10 piece needle files, Tekton 3592 precision 5 piece pliers set and see through lettering guide (02145) set. Excellent for keeping your small tools in one portable spot. I gave it four stars because my 228-piece rotary set wouldn't fit inside. This kit needs to sit flat. I like that the opening flaps have wires in them. This keeps the bag open and makes it easy to zip shut. It's a good tough bag. John
customer_reviews.author: John Conner

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for my small supply of hammer
customer_reviews.text: This has been on my wish list for 2 years. Finally bought it for myself. This is perfect for my small supply of hammer, pliers, wrench, screwdrivers and nails that I use for household minor repairing. It is not for the major tool owner in your household.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Great Truck Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tool bag as a travel bag for storing behind the seat of a standard cab Silverado truck. I couldn't have asked for a better bag for this function. I have some cheap tools stored in this bag, and it fits well behind the seat. Being as this bag is soft, it stores really well and doesn't slide all around and upset the passengers. This bag will just hang out in the corner and be there when you need it. I also use the bag for storing small ratchet straps and supplies for securing dirt bikes and such, and it works great for this purpose as well.
customer_reviews.author: Just_Another_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality not so good.
customer_reviews.text: Zip did not last more than a weekend. Seeking replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A. Iovannitti

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for the price. It's a sturdy little bag. I wish the pockets along the front were a little bit deeper towards the bottom of the bag. They sort of open up at the top which makes whatever you put in them sort of project away from the bag. Regardless, that wasn't much of an issue for me, I was mostly concerned on things falling out of the pockets. Other than that, this is a great little bag to keep your essentials in.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, Can fit quite a bit, easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: I like these bags, this is my second one. You can fit more than you would expect by looking at it. It's made of a thick, tough material that doesn't wear out easily. These bags are way more rugged than an equivalently priced plastic tool-box.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P.

customer_reviews.title: This bag is cute with a lot of little pockets ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag is cute with a lot of little pockets but really really small. I am not the kind of person who has a ton of tools in my possession, but for what I do have, this doesn’t hold it. I could fit a hammer and some wrenches and screwdrivers in it, but I also have one little cordless drill that wouldn’t fit even on its own. I wouldn’t buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! Sturdy and well - made. I was looking for something to hold my WORX Switchdriver and the accompanying accessories - charger, extra battery, drill and driver bits. Everything fits perfectly, and there are plenty of pockets to fit even more items. I just ordered another one to replace a tool bag with no pockets. This one will make it much easier to find things without having to dig around to find what I want.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. O.

customer_reviews.title: Cat transporter
customer_reviews.text: Boy this bag is great. I do alot of flying and I bring lots of kittens with me. It is expensive to pay for the kittens to travel so I use this bag to hide them. I put a kitten in each pouch and then put a utility knife or tape measure over each kitten, and then it looks like a tool bag. But its not-its a kitten transporter. So then I bring it on board and then I don’t pay for the kittens. Sometimes they attempt to pop their head out or meow, then I have to sing during the flight.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jumps

customer_reviews.title: Great power tool storage bag
customer_reviews.text: I ordered both this tool bag and the Craftsman 13" tool bag, one each of different purposes. The Stanley bag is excellent for small to medium sized power tools acquired in an over-sized (or under-sized) box that isn't functional for tool storage and mobility. It is lined with pockets, both fixed and adjustable (via Velcro), located both inside and outside the bag... making it excellent for tools that have lots of accessories or small jobs (like at the in-law's house) where you need lots of different types of fasteners. It isn't good as a general tool box replacement, the Craftsman is better suited for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: griffen

customer_reviews.title: so I'm not using this for facilities work or anything like that. It's probably adequate for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This is okay. It will hold a few every day handy man tools for work around the house or what have you but is not as large as I thought it would be. If you want to build a heavy duty tool kit, you will want a larger bag. I bought this to fit a few general tools in that will mostly be used in IT related work, so I'm not using this for facilities work or anything like that. It's probably adequate for my needs, but just be aware it's a light weight tool kit. Otherwise, it's alright.
customer_reviews.author: J Lam

customer_reviews.title: I’m very happy with this tool box
customer_reviews.text: Im a contractor and this is the perfect project tool box. Most of the time I don’t need my big tool box. This is perfect for throwing in the tools you need for a specific job!
customer_reviews.author: Red Shield

customer_reviews.title: Great small tool carrier.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to hold some baking utensils that I strictly use for gluten free baking. Fits everything that I need with the exception of my gallon measuring pitcher. I am very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jonie Phillipi

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: This tool bag is a real bargain. I doubt you will be able to find a better bag at this price point. The construction and materials seem to be very sturdy and of good quality. The straps feel strong and are comfortable to grip. I have stored a complete screwdriver set and a set of metric wrenches with plenty of room to spare. The side pouches are handy and have a reflective stripe. I use the side pouches for a tape measure, box cutter and a volt meter. This would be an excellent bag to keep in the car or home for smaller jobs.
customer_reviews.author: casanezo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: very useful product for your tools. light and easy to carry Follow-up August 26 2018...Still a good tool bag and holding up well the one problem however is to keep the bag balanced on both sides with tools otherwise the bag sill fall to one side or the other. The outside pockets are made to carry various tools but if you overload one side the bag will fall over to that side and some tools may drop out. These bags are nice but sometimes the old toolbox can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky D

customer_reviews.title: Used this for an emergency kit!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for creating an emergency kit for your car in case you are really stranded. I was able to put a leatherman, rope, solar/crank-able radio (can charge iPhone too) solar flashlight, a first aid kit, emergency blankets, and emergency fire starter kit. I also plan on adding some food. There are tons of pockets on the outside and it zips close! It's lightweight canvas but sturdy so it easy to carry. It's definitely a great way to carry tools or emergency items in case the world goes crazy! I bought this as a gift for someone at Christmas with the emergency items. Now I plan to buy one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: netkat

customer_reviews.title: A compact, VERY durable and well-organized bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a portable tool box to replace our bulky plastic one, and this tool bag has been outstanding. It carries a lot of tools (it is durable) but it also has a lot of compartments to keep your tools organized when they're in the bag. This tool bag has been great. We're able to tuck tools away and keep them organized in a compact, durable bag. I would totally buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Pete O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Excellent apartment tool bag
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter who was moving into an apartment on her own and wanted to give her a handy tool bag for all the things she might need. We stocked it with all the common tools including the Cartman Orange 39-Piece Tool Set - General Household Hand Tool Kit also purchased on Amazon. It's better than a hard tool box and perfect for anyone who needs a convenient place to store tools.
customer_reviews.author: The Admiral

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool bag
customer_reviews.text: Was the perfect size for my black and decker drill. The bag is also made of nice material and does not feel cheap. I appreciate the multiple outside and inside side compartments, which are useful for putting little things in.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bag at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the Craftsman tool bag I had for years. My Craftsman didn't have pockets on the inside but this one has many. Both are about the same price but I decided to try something new. The only drawback is that the mouth of this bag doesn't open as wide as the Craftsman did and it's probably because the Craftsman was an inch (13 in) bigger. It was easier to search in the Craftsman bag. Not a big deal though. My dog loved this bag too since he chewed through one of the handles and a pocket within a week or receiving the bag. I guess it's a great chew toy as well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Y.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool bag in terms of size and pocket layout
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag basically for a Milwaukee drill driver and multitool and accessories. The Milwaukee bag that came with the set is nice but limited with the number of pockets for smaller items to keep organized. This bag is about twice the size by volume making it capable of holding my drill, multi tool, both batteries, drill bit set, and charger in the main compartment. There are pockets inside that help with the organization of the different tools the multi tool can handle. The outside pockets are great for holding general plier's, crescent wrenchs, and other misc tools. Very nice bag for what I wanted it for.
customer_reviews.author: TTQ

customer_reviews.title: Great for Shop Organization
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these. I keep related tools in separate bags (pocket screw tools in one, heat gun/hot glue gun in another, riveter and rivets in a third, and so on). The bags fit together on a shelf much better than a hard case would, and they're easy to label (I make tags with wood disks from the craft store and attach them to the zipper pull with split rings). The storage capacity is great, and they help keep small parts with the tool that uses them.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Evans

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied in Woodburn
customer_reviews.text: I had previously ordered a Craftsman for my bigger tools but needed something smaller and not quite as spendy. I ordered 2 of these bags and was glad I did. They are perfect for what I wanted them for. Quite large inside and lots of Velcro pockets. Zipper is good and sturdy and I like the wide mouth for easy access. Price was excellent and was worth it. Very satisfied and would surely buy this product again as they can be used for different purposes and of course they are Stanley. Thanks Amazon for offering them
customer_reviews.author: kittylover

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size Perfect price
customer_reviews.text: Ever need to carry a few tools with you? Not your big bag but more than 2 hand fulls? Wish I hand done this years ago. If you don't use tools daily this is a great all purpose bag perfect for all your stuff. If you do use tools daily this is perfect for the times you need more than a couple but less than a big bag. A serviceman's perfect mate. If you say I just need this tool and maybe that and maybe one other - get this. Carry a good, handy bunch of tools without filling both hands and all your pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Gemini 88

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag because.........
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this tool bag for medical bag, and it's just right size to put all emergency items such as cold/hot pack, bandaid, antibiotic ointment, tapes, etc. I had little accident that I cut my big toe deeply and needed emergency item quickly to stop bleeding such as bandage/tape to stop bleeding; antiboitic ointment for infection, cold pack to reduce swelling and pain; , etc. And I realized that I didn't keep those things same place. So I bought this because size is just right, and strong structure, durable, and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool Bag
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a big set of tools but I do have the essentials. This bag is quite big enough for me and you can tell it is constructed well and made from durable material. Lots of pockets inside and out to keep your tools organized. Not everybody needs a giant collection of hand tools and this bag is perfect for the casual handy-person. This might also be a great gift for your son or daughter moving out into their first dorm/apartment/home. I recommend this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G.

customer_reviews.title: Buy This! Worth double the price.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool bag. It comes with various inside pockets. Yes, it is “soft,” but the sides and bottom are reinforced giving it that firm secure feel. Great value for the money. Plenty of room. I bought the 12”. It does fit a full hammer, as well. Lots of secure pockets inside and outside. Incredibly spacious.
customer_reviews.author: Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: This is ridiculous. The bag advertised IS NOT the bag that shows up at your house. The zipper isn’t sewn on right and just seems like a knock off.

customer_reviews.title: Great for my little guy
customer_reviews.text: My youngest is always following me around the house asking to help. So, this year I bought him his own tool set. The bag is perfect for what he needs. Simple access and the quality of the material is very durable. No problems with the zipper top and he's loving it!
customer_reviews.author: Renata Dean

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Tool Bag for the trunk of a daughter's car!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Stanley STST70574 12-inch Soft Sided Tool Bag to contain the Viair 85 Portable Air Compressor that I ordered for my daughter's car. It holds the portable air compressor just fine, with room left over for a few essential tools. I found the Stanley Tool Bag to be well constructed and rugged enough for years of use. Yes, I am pleased! I just hope my daughter can keep up with it for more than a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell W. Riggins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tool Bag for Toddler!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bag for our 3-year old for Christmas. He wanted a bag like Daddy had, and this was perfect!! It's just the right size for him, yet it's SUPEr durable and looks just like a bag his Daddy would use for his tools. The price is awesome, considering it's holding plastic screwdrivers and fake hammers! great option if you need a tool bag for a little one!
customer_reviews.author: Busy Momma of Two

customer_reviews.title: It's a sturdy bag and it did its job.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! It's an excellent price for a smaller sized bag. It pretty much holds all the tools I use regularly at work. I keep a clip board in it as well but the top zipper doesn't go with that in there. Lots of pockets inside for weird stuff. The only downside is that I wish the handles were a touch bigger but it's because I stuff all kinds of things in there and try to carry it around.
customer_reviews.author: Nina O.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for the price. It hold all the basic tools i need it to hold. I store maybe 10-15 tools in it and it 3/4 full. nice side pockets hold odds and ends like screws and such. Bag seems well made and makes a great travel tool bag too. what i keep in the bag. - small hammer - 6 screwdrivers - 2 sets of pliers - level - 2 wrenches - tape measure - box cutter - few more items
customer_reviews.author: Travis Duke

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a year or so ago. My husband still uses it. It is on the smaller side, but still sturdy and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany B

customer_reviews.title: Emergency repair bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an "emergency repair kit" for my Avalanche. Haven't needed it yet and hope I never do, but if trouble happens on the road I want to able to try something other than just stand there and scratch my head. Stanley has never disappointed me in the past. My bag is now full of a nice assortment of Stanley tools, which will no doubt be useful for other needs while away from my home shop since my "need to tinker" with things is never-ending.
customer_reviews.author: snakecatcher2000

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a tool bag just to carry the essential tools and this bag is more than perfect for that. For the price it's not a tool bag I'd be mad replacing in a couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great, roomy tool bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect soft tool bag for the trunk of the car. I bought a few of these, then ordered a few more. They made great gifts. Everyone needs something to keep basic tools in your vehicle in like a flashlight, screwdrivers, wrenches, rags, jumper cables, etc. This is large enough to stuff a lot of stuff into, I bought these really cheap on Black Friday, I think I paid 4 bucks a piece for them. They are worth way more than that. I would have paid 20 bucks for them at my hardware store and considered it a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag to take to work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag for my husband to carry his lunch and other belongings to work. It has lots of pockets to stash items like gum, keys or his phone. And it has plenty of room for his lunch and a few other items. It's not big though, keep that in mind. But it has just the right amount of space for his needs.
customer_reviews.author: MKuhlman

customer_reviews.title: Well Made & Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for well made bag. I wished it was about 2” wider and 1” higher - so my longer tools would fit better. Again, well made & great price! I would recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: LJA

customer_reviews.title: Great bag at a great price
customer_reviews.text: A great little tool/gadget bag. Actually bought this as a gift for a guitar & banjo fanatic! They used it to store tools, gadgets, strings, etc for tinkering and playing with their guitars and banjos. It's a great size - not huge but has lots of external and internal pockets, can open wide for easy access into the interior, and is soft sided so no chance of dinging any instruments. And it's got a great price.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Great size for a household toolbox, the smallest I could find. I keep this one in the kitchen with everyday tools which saves me from going to the garage or basement for small jobs. It is sturdy but a tad short for a full size hammer or larger mallet; they still fit but snugly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon frequent buyer

customer_reviews.title: Need a well built, easy to carry bag?
customer_reviews.text: This bag had just the perfect amount of room. It holds the "heating gun" with my extension cord and anything else that I might need with peeling paint off the wall. Extra room for my cellphone, on the side! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Weber

customer_reviews.title: Great size, great utility
customer_reviews.text: This is a project bag, i.e. used to gather various tools from my electrical, plumbing, carpentry and mechanical tool boxes for specific jobs around the house or on the road. I can fit a power drill and bits and a lot of hand tools with plenty of exterior and interior pockets to keep tools organized. Must have for those diy types that don't want to carry all of their tool boxes around. When a project is over, I return some items back to the appropriate tool boxes, leaving some basic items in the bag for a quick grab and go.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: My Husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a father's day gift from the children... My husband loves it! Uses it for his plumbing supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and good quality tool bag
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, and cheap price. Not as big as i thought it would be, but still i'm able to put my cordless drill with battery, as well as all my other tools. Quality seems good, doesn't look cheap to the point that it'll start ripping after a few years. I also liked those outside pockets for additional slots to put your tools in. if your a contractor or an advanced do it yourself er...this bag may be too small for you. But for novice to non experts like myself doing little house jobs here and there this bag i think is perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Yay space and organizing.
customer_reviews.text: Pros 1 nice size 2 carries a lot of tools in a short area 3 lots of pockets 4 fits in my locker at work and provides organizability. Cons 1 doesnt have a good way to store sockets, wish it had a zippered pocket for small stuff
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha B.

customer_reviews.title: A good enough bag, but 12" holds less than you might think.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son who was collecting a few tools working on his car. The bag is well enough made, it's just ultimately a little too small for my original intended use of keeping the tools he was carrying in the car. Not the bag's fault. So I ended up getting him a more serious sized tool box. Problem solved. Now it's in my shop for when I need a go bag to carry a tool selection for small jobs around the house. That works out pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Solderer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic little tool bag my apartment. I live in NYC where storage space is at a premium and I previously used a hard-sided plastic tool box that took up way too much space in our closet. This bag is sturdy and incredibly well made (at any price, but especially for $10!) and holds everything we need for household repairs. We keep a few measuring tapes, a hammer, pilers, wrench, level, several screw drivers, multiple bags of spare nails and screws, and a flashlight in here with room to spare, and it takes up minimal space in our closet. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Good size to keep dedicated/specialty sets of tools together.
customer_reviews.text: Good small tool bag. Sturdy zipper, easy to access, several outside and inside pockets. On one side the middle pocket has a flap with velcro; use that one for manuals and user guides. I bought several to hold my different tool kits: bicycle, electrical, truck tools. Put labels on them so I can just grab the right bag and get to work.
customer_reviews.author: L. Blake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bag for smaller tool sets.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bag for smaller tool sets. I used it for my soldering equipment, but one might use it for a wrench set, screw drivers, a drill and related equipment, or perhaps for storing just a few tools needed inside the house for occasional repair. The are adjustable pockets inside and out, as well as a area inside for use with larger items such as spools of wire, solder, etc. Excellent construction. Rugged.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Great small tool bag for indoor tools
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect bag for holding inside house tools. Has a big space in the center with notches for smaller screwdrivers on the inside walls. Pockets on outside can hold other stuff like pliers, and small levels, and an outside zip lock pocket for holding whatever smaller stuff you have. Big enough to put tools in but small enough to tuck right into pantry floor. Nice strong zipper closes the large inner bag up tight.
customer_reviews.author: Cattleya

customer_reviews.title: nice tool bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag works great for home repairs, I just take the tools I may need and the repair is a lot faster.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K

customer_reviews.title: Very good and useful Soft Sided Tool Bag
customer_reviews.text: Very good and useful Soft Sided Tool Bag. When you rest it open on any plain surface it remains opened (like a doctor's bag) For the use around my house it is unbeatable. Lightweight and Roomy. I actually bought two more a couple weeks later. one extra for me and one as a gift for my dear Mother in Law who likes to go around fixing everything in the house, with all scattered tools in her hand.
customer_reviews.author: Urban G

customer_reviews.title: Around house bag for tools
customer_reviews.text: You can definitely feel the sturdiness in the bag our pockets are perfect handle carries a lot you're doing something around the house this is what I would choose
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiiloa

customer_reviews.title: Good bag but have issues with the zipper
customer_reviews.text: The bag is slightly smaller than I thought it would be which doesn't bother me too much. But the zipper is hard to use when you try to close the bag even when it's empty. When the bag is full you actually need 3 hands to close it easily because you need to pull on the end of the zipper while zipping it shut while holding the bag closed. So there's some zipping acrobatics involved when closing the bag.
customer_reviews.author: G. Omura

customer_reviews.title: A great sturdy bag that can fit more than you might think
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic quality! I was afraid it would be too small but it is just right. And the pockets are a life saver. In it I currently have : screwdriver, mini screwdriver, multi tool, hard tape measure, small extension cord, lens pen, sharpies, zip ties, Caribbeans, light meter, lens wipes, lens blower, scissors, 2 hex key sets, and a few other trinkets. I will be using this bag for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Clancy

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Recently, I purchased a set of tools for my nine year old, and they're adorable, kid-sized and real. However, I didn't have a tool box for him. This, as I'm sure you can imagine, is very upsetting for him. I looked for a while, and then stumbled across this. It came, and I'm very impressed. I don't think it would fit a grown-up man's tools, but for my little man, it was perfect. Great quality, too.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Nice small tool bag
customer_reviews.text: Has gone to the junkyard with me many times, and is a very handy thing to have. It has many pouches and compartments for separating your tools. It has never ripped and is made from very durable material. I'd recommend this for anyone looking for a small tool bag that's easily stored or carried anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chace Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Bag
customer_reviews.text: Great for holding a basic tool set for home use - very durable and fits a surprisingly large amount of stuff. The top zips closed when not in use, but also is designed to open wide enough to see the whole bag.
customer_reviews.author: CodeRed747

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Zipper broke the first day I used it. Other then that it's a good bag.
customer_reviews.author: PureKH4OS

customer_reviews.title: Great for pros also
customer_reviews.text: My dad asked my for those, he is an electrician and needed some portable toolbox. if you are looking for a good looking, modern, quality toolbox- take this one!
customer_reviews.author: Elad

customer_reviews.title: Great tool bag
customer_reviews.text: This makes for a nice tool carrier. I have collected a bunch of random supplies over the years and now I proudly store them in this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Donn

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This bag is strong and after loading it with heavy tools it has withstood the test of time without a rip or tear and at some point it even got wet when it rained for an entire week it was actually holding water inside the pockets. This is a great tool bag that seems to be durable and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Miguitron

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Not much I can say about a tool bag, but it seems to be durable enough. There are pockets inside to hold pliers and what not. It barely fit my 13oz hammer, so you may need to measure the dimensions of the largest tool that you plan to fit in the bag. It is 12 inches across as stated in the product description, but has enough slack to easily stretch another inch or two. The label reads 100% Polyester and Made in China... for anyone that cares.
customer_reviews.author: Bulltooth

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag. Holds a lot. I have been able to round up all my tools around the house and now everything is one place when I need it. No more hunting to find my hammer, screwdrivers, or small drill when I need them and trying to remember where I last used them. I also have room to put in the couple of boxes of nails and screws that I have so they are not taking up room in kitchen drawers.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Great for car trunk tools.
customer_reviews.text: I got this Stanley tool bag to keep tools in my car trunk. Works perfectly for that. It even has two vertical reflective strips on the outer pocket cover. The inside is roomy and has a few interior pockets for smaller tools. The outside has pockets for a flashlight and gloves. The bag is made of heavy-duty material and won't collapse while open. For only ten dollars, it would make a great gift for a new car owner.
customer_reviews.author: kez panel project

customer_reviews.title: Too small and not enough compartments
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is okay, though it arrived looking a lot smaller than I expected it would be, even though I consulted my measuring tap before ordering it. I also wish that it had more compartments inside the bag--that would have made it more useful for me. I returned it and bought a larger bag.
customer_reviews.author: gwendolina

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag. I have recently went into the attic ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag. I have recently went into the attic and packed it full of everything I thought I could ever need up there and the bag had to weigh 100 pounds (caused me to sweat just moving the bag) and it felt like I could over fill it more. The side pouches I found are risky in that they are not tight at all and tools simply fall out if the bag leans over.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, well constructed tool bag
customer_reviews.text: This tool bag keeps all my household tools in one place - which I like, is nicely constructed, no problems holding the tools I've placed in there and could hold several more as well. I like the extra pockets on the outside too. Designed well for the intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine in Carson City

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool bag.
customer_reviews.text: I needed an extra small tool beg just for my two small battery operated drills, along with their bits and extra batteries. Now I know where everything is when I go to use one of the drills. This would be a great all-purpose bag as well. It is sturdy and has pockets inside and outside so that small accessories or tools won't fall to the bottom of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Well made and compact size makes this a 5 star from me.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag to house my Work Sharp Ken Onion knife/tool sharpener and all of the belts. It's a compact bag that allows me to fit the sharpener and all belts while taking up a minimum of space. Thumbs up from me.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well.
customer_reviews.text: Great for short trips carrying tools. Has held up well for several months and holds lots of tools
customer_reviews.author: Justmetwo

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool Bag! A Home Run!
customer_reviews.text: This tool bag has exceeded my expectations. It it the perfect size for me, not to big not to small. My 12"x7" pouch was overflowing with tools and so this is the perfect solution. The bag and the pockets on the inside and out are well made and so is the zipper. And the price is very reasonable. This purchase is a home run!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer NY

customer_reviews.title: Great moving gift for your college kids!
customer_reviews.text: 24/F- I bought this for my in home tool kit for basic repairs. It's big enough to fit all my hammers, screwdrivers, a picture hanging kit, and other basic home maintenance. My brother is moving out of college and into his own house soon so I'm going to buy him one and fill it with helpful tools that I use for basic maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney W.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bag!
customer_reviews.text: Just needed a small, cheap bag to hold a few items. This bag is a little larger than I expected, but it's not too big. It's actually a perfect size now that I have it. It's built very well & has plenty of pockets. It holds more than enough for me. I'm a very new woodworker, but I don't think I could've found a better bag for this price. I'll be using this bag for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gaczewski

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to our toddler for his toy tools!
customer_reviews.author: June Bug

customer_reviews.title: Great size for portability - but deceptively large!
customer_reviews.text: I now own 3 of these bags. One for general hardware, one for electrical, and another as my "hobby" bag. They are a great size to fit and organize a large amount of tools, and still be able to easily grab and take out to "fix" your project. There seems to be a pocket for just about everything in here. Can't say enough about the great value these toolbags are. Extremely happy.
customer_reviews.author: SomeoneWhoCares

customer_reviews.title: love it perfect for my tools around the house
customer_reviews.text: its a small bag but works perfect to hold all the basic tools for around the house
customer_reviews.author: Keith G.

product_meta.title: Stanley STST70574 12-Inch Soft Sided Tool Bag
product_meta.description: The Stanley STST70574 12-Inch Tool Bag is ideal for carrying hand tools and other small to medium-sized items. The adjustable strap allows for easy access to contents. A rubber foam bottom keeps bag sturdy and helps protect contents from hard falls, and an outer mesh pocket stores personal items.
feature_bullets: Adjustable strap allows for easy access to contents
Ideal for carrying hand tools and other small to medium items
Rubber foam bottom keeps bag sturdy, protects contents from hard falls
Outer mesh pocket stores personal belongings, small tools & accessories

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,314 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
